title: Big loans, bigger worries: Al-Falah students in a fix; many say they‚Äôve prepared for the worst
content: Al-Falah University students face immense anxiety after a professor was identified as a Delhi terror attack bomber and the founder was arrested. Concerns mount over the university's future, course accreditation, job prospects, and the substantial loans parents have taken for their children's expensive medical education.

title: Delhi school suicide: How a 'warning' over dance practice pushed teen to the brink; details emerge
content: A 16-year-old student, Shourya Patil, tragically died after reportedly jumping from a metro station, following a dispute with teachers over a dance performance due to a sprained ankle. A suicide note found in his bag blamed the school staff for his actions, leading to an FIR against four teachers who have since been suspended and barred from school contact.

title: '7km long, 25m deep': Israel reveals one of Gaza's 'largest & most complex' tunnels - video
content: The IDF revealed a vast Hamas tunnel network in southern Gaza, reportedly used to hold the body of soldier Hadar Goldin. This complex, stretching over seven kilometers and featuring numerous rooms, ran beneath civilian areas. Hamas returned Goldin's remains after 11 years, following his abduction during the 2014 Gaza War.

title: Bangladesh earthquake: At least 6 killed, several injured; visuals emerge
content: A powerful 5.5-magnitude earthquake rocked central Bangladesh, claiming at least six lives and injuring many in Dhaka as buildings swayed and structures collapsed. The tremors were widely felt across the country and in neighbouring Indian regions, including Kolkata. Authorities are assessing damage and monitoring aftershocks in the densely populated capital.

title: Coal mafia crackdown: ED raids 40+ sites in Jharkhand, Bengal; huge stash of cash, gold seized
content: The Enforcement Directorate conducted extensive searches at over 40 locations in Jharkhand and West Bengal as part of a money laundering probe into coal mafia operations. The investigation targets alleged coal theft, pilferage, and illegal mining, with significant financial losses to the government suspected.

title: Jeff Bezos warns of recession: Amazon founder advises what to take off the table
content: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos is urging consumers and businesses to delay major purchases amid growing recession fears. He advises households to save for big-ticket items like cars and appliances, while small businesses should avoid large capital expenditures.  Despite this caution, Bezos remains optimistic about the long-term American Dream and future space travel accessibility.

title: 'A player‚Äôs career is on the line': Rahane fires warning shot at Gambhir over No.3 chaos
content: Former India vice-captain Ajinkya Rahane expressed concern over India's inconsistent selection for the crucial No. 3 batting position. He highlighted that frequent changes, like promoting Washington Sundar over Sai Sudharsan, disrupt player development and require specific preparation. Rahane emphasized the need for clarity and a long-term approach to nurture players in this pivotal role.

title: Vande Bharat sleeper: When will Railways launch new train? Vaishnaw shares imp update
content: Vande Bharat sleeper train launch: Indian Railways is set to launch its first Vande Bharat sleeper train in December, with the prototype undergoing modifications for enhanced passenger comfort. Following extensive trials, adjustments are being made to the bogies and seats to meet high standards.

title: Gold price today: Yellow metal slips; check 24K, 22K city-wise rates
content: Gold and silver prices declined in futures trade as strong US employment data diminished expectations of a December interest rate cut by the Federal Reserve. A stronger dollar also pressured bullion, leading to a fall in both domestic and global markets.

title: Black Friday sale 2025: When it starts; all you need to know
content: Black Friday 2025 is now a month-long shopping event. Major retailers like Amazon, Walmart, Target, Best Buy, and Macys are launching sales early. Shoppers can find significant discounts online and in stores. Deals are expected on electronics, appliances, clothing, and more. The sales period runs through Cyber Monday, December 1.

title: Earthquake shocks Dhaka Test: Play halted during Bangladesh vs Ireland match ‚Äì Watch
content: Play in the Mirpur Test was briefly halted by an earthquake, unsettling players and spectators alike. Before the tremors, Ireland showed resilience, reaching 113 with a vital partnership. This followed Bangladesh's dominant day two, where Mushfiqur Rahim and Litton Das scored centuries, setting a strong total of 476.

title: 'Going since Trump boycotting it': Congress targets PM Modi over G20 summit
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh criticized PM Modi's G20 attendance, suggesting it was 'safe' due to US President Donald Trump's boycott. Ramesh questioned future 'huglomacy' with Trump, especially with the next summit in the US and ongoing trade talks. He also highlighted US opposition to South Africa's G20 themes.

title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella to employees: Must rapidly rethink AI
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has appointed Rolf Harms, the executive behind the influential 2010 "Economics of the Cloud" white paper, to help rethink Microsoft's business model for the AI era. In an internal memo obtained by Business Insider, Nadella emphasized the need to rapidly transform the company's approach to AI economics, similar to its cloud computing pivot 15 years ago. The move reflects Nadella's concerns about Microsoft's survival in the AI era, as he warned employees that some of the company's biggest businesses may become irrelevant without fundamental changes.

title: Himachali man missing for 45 years returns home; memory returns after second head injury
content: After a head injury at 16, Himachal's Rikhi Ram lost his memory and built a new life in Nanded, Maharashtra, marrying and raising three children. Another head injury decades later triggered flashes of his past, leading him to be reunited with his family after 45 years.

title: IND vs SA: Shubman Gill released from squad; Rishabh Pant to lead India in Guwahati Test
content: India's Test captain Shubman Gill has been released from the squad for the Guwahati Test and is heading to Mumbai for rest and specialist consultation. Rishabh Pant will lead the team in Gill's absence, with Sai Sudharsan and Nitish Kumar Reddy being frontrunners for selection. The team management is also addressing concerns about the playing surface after the first Test.

title: Faridabad: Video shows ammonium nitrate cache in secluded hideout; what initial probe suggests
content: Investigators are probing a Delhi car blast, with a video of 2,600kg of ammonium nitrate resurfacing. Terror accused Muzammil Shakeel allegedly sought a cleric's help to store explosives. Doctors Shaheen Shahid and Muzammil Shakeel are being questioned about a potential serial bombing plot linked to the attack.

title: Savannah James gets emotional as daughter Zhuri joins new SZN Volleyball team
content: Savannah James celebrated her daughter Zhuri Nova's milestone as she begins her volleyball journey with the popular SZN team. Despite her family's basketball background, Zhuri Nova chose a different athletic path. The proud mother shared heartwarming clips and reflected on Zhuri Nova's 11th birthday, highlighting her daughter's intelligence and confidence.

title: Brittany Mahomes says fame as Patrick Mahomes‚Äô wife has been emotionally hard
content: Brittany Mahomes, wife of NFL star Patrick Mahomes, has candidly shared her struggles with online hate. She revealed that while it's been a difficult journey, she's learned to protect her peace by stepping away from social media when negativity escalates. Despite facing criticism for her opinions and public presence, she remains a strong supporter of her husband and their family.

title: Taylor Swift‚Äôs 'magical' presence leaves Travis Kelce completely speechless
content: Travis Kelce is celebrating Taylor Swift's guest appearance on his podcast, 'New Heights,' which Apple ranked as one of the top episodes of 2025. The episode, recorded before their engagement, shattered viewership records, surpassing even Kylie Kelce's previous mark. Swift shared personal insights, and Travis credits her 'magical' star power for the immense success, highlighting their significant cultural influence.

title: 34 years later! Mitchell Starc breaks Ashes record last seen in 1991
content: Starc's 7 for 58 is now the best bowling performance of his Test career, surpassing his previous best of 6 for 9 against the West Indies in Kingston earlier this year and 6 for 48 against India in Adelaide in 2024. It is also the best bowling analysis ever recorded at Perth Stadium. Starc became only the second Australian bowler this century to take a seven-wicket haul at home in an Ashes Test.

title: Flames, smoke, sirens: Delegates flee as fire erupts at COP30 Summit in Brazil‚Äî Watch
content: A fire at the COP30 climate summit in Belem, Brazil, disrupted crucial negotiations on fossil fuels and climate finance.  The blaze, likely from electrical equipment, forced thousands to evacuate but was quickly controlled.  This incident, the third major disruption, occurred as delegates raced against time to reach a vital global climate action deal, with UN chief urging ambitious compromise.

title: World Rapid & Blitz 2025: 'Tighter jeans this time' - Carlsen reignites 'fashion war' with FIDE
content: Returning to the World Rapid & Blitz Championship in Doha, Magnus Carlsen isn't holding back ‚Äì he has playfully resurrected the 'jeansgate' drama from last year in a recent social media post. With a nod to 'viral rage moments' and a commitment to tighter jeans, he teases a fun and defiant stance towards FIDE‚Äôs attire rules.

title: Gold price prediction: Outlook for today - why does it face resistance at Rs 1,22,850
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are exhibiting an intraday weakening bias, with traders advised to sell on rallies. Technical indicators suggest resistance around ‚Çπ1,22,700‚Äì‚Çπ1,22,850, and a bearish crossover in moving averages points to further downside pressure.

title: 'Boycott politics never work': SA Prez reacts to Trump's no-show at G20; US fires sharp response
content: South Africa's President Cyril Ramaphosa stated the United States indicated a possible change of mind regarding its G20 summit boycott. The White House swiftly rejected this, calling it fake news and confirming only a formal handover ceremony attendance. Tensions remain high as South Africa hosts the G20 for the first time.

title: 'Rs 95 lakh per semester paid for Karisma Kapoor's daughter': Priya Sachdev's lawyer
content: A Delhi High Court hearing saw Priya Kapur's legal team present strong evidence refuting claims of a forged will by Sunjay Kapur. Documentation, including fee receipts and digital trails, countered allegations, while the court examined the will's creation and authenticity. The case continues on November 21.

title: Gautam Gambhir under fire: 'Were we wasting time with Karun Nair or Sai Sudharsan?'
content: India's frequent batting order changes, particularly at number 3, have drawn criticism. Former batter Aakash Chopra questions the team's long-term vision, citing Washington Sundar's promotion over Sai Sudharsan and Karun Nair. Chopra emphasizes prioritizing pure batting skills for the top order, suggesting recent experiments have been futile without clear strategy and consistency.

title: ‚ÄòReaching Bengaluru from space is easier‚Äô: Shux‚Äôs quip on city‚Äôs traffic goes viral
content: Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla highlighted Bengaluru's traffic woes, humorously stating his commute from Marathahalli took longer than his presentation. IT Minister Priyank Kharge echoed this sentiment at a tech summit, promising solutions to the city's congestion issues.

title: IMF‚Äôs big warning on Pakistan economy! Flags deep corruption risks
content: Pakistan faces a critical juncture as a delayed IMF report reveals deep-rooted corruption and weak institutions.  The Fund warns that only swift, comprehensive reforms can stabilize the economy.  Implementing a governance overhaul could boost GDP significantly, but systemic failures persist, impacting revenue and public trust.  Urgent action is needed to address these pervasive issues.

title: Japan stimulus push: Cabinet approves $135.4 billion package - here's what it includes
content: Japan's Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi unveiled a massive ¬•21.3 trillion stimulus package, its largest since the pandemic, to combat inflation's impact on citizens and businesses. This significant fiscal move, featuring energy subsidies and tax relief, aims to ease rising living costs.

title: Ashes: Panesar hits back at Smith; calls Sandpapergate 'worst cheating in Aussie history'
content: An off-field storm has erupted in the Ashes as former England spinner Monty Panesar fiercely responded to stand-in Australia skipper Steve Smith's mockery of his Celebrity Mastermind appearance. Panesar branded Smith's comments as proof of mental vulnerability, suggesting England had already gotten inside the Australian captain's head ahead of the series opener.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in red; BSE Sensex down over 250 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Friday on weak global cues. While Nifty50 was above 26,100, BSE Sensex was down over 250 points.

title: What happened to Adrian Hill? Veteran referee‚Äôs injury explained from Bills vs Texans game
content: Referee Adrian Hill suffered a sudden lower-leg injury during the Bills-Texans game, forcing an unusual halt and a shift in momentum. Veteran umpire Roy Ellison took over as referee, ensuring the game resumed smoothly. Hill's exit highlighted the physical demands on officials and his unique background as an aerospace engineer.

title: Tariff relief: Trump drops 40% levies on Brazilian food imports including beef, coffee
content: US President Donald Trump has reversed steep tariffs on Brazilian food imports, including beef and coffee, a move expected to lower costs for American consumers. The 40% duties, imposed in July, are lifted for shipments arriving after November 13. This decision follows growing voter frustration over rising living expenses and signals progress in trade talks with Brazil.

title: 'Yunus can't touch my mother': Sheikh Hasina's son slams death verdict
content: Ousted Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's son, Sajeeb Wazed, asserted that interim leader Muhammad Yunus cannot harm his mother, despite her death sentence. Wazed criticized the trial as illegal and unconstitutional, alleging a lack of due process and biased judges. He also drew parallels between Yunus and Aung San Suu Kyi regarding Nobel Prizes and alleged state failures.

title: Delhi St Columba's School suicide case: 4 teachers suspended
content: Four teachers at St. Columba's School have been suspended following the suicide of a Class X student, Shourya Patil. The student's family alleges he was repeatedly humiliated and targeted by teachers. A suicide note found in his bag named the teachers and requested action, prompting protests and an ongoing police investigation.

title: India, Israel set to launch talks for free trade pact
content: India and Israel have officially launched negotiations for a free trade agreement, signing terms of reference to guide discussions. The pact aims to boost trade by removing barriers, facilitating investment, and enhancing cooperation in innovation and technology. Israel has assured India it won't seek market access in sensitive sectors like dairy and agriculture, opening new avenues for bilateral commerce.

title: IND vs SA: Former India cricketer advises Shubman Gill to take a break - 'Skip the IPL' -
content: Shubman Gill's recent neck spasm has sparked debate on player workload. Despite a packed schedule, coach Gautam Gambhir believes players should skip the IPL if workload is an issue, not international duty. Aakash Chopra agrees, emphasizing maximizing form when fit and not mentally fatigued, as Gill faces a recovery period before upcoming series.

title: Ranji Trophy: Who after Ashwin? Nikhil, the 6'2" bowler from Haryana, is up for the challenge
content: Haryana's Nikhil Kashyap is the lone off-spinner in the top 20 wicket-takers‚Äô list in this season's Ranji Trophy. With 24 wickets in five matches, the 25-year-old, in his debut season, has set the Ranji Trophy on fire. He is ninth on the leading wicket-takers list and, with his tall frame, is someone selectors can keep a close eye on for the future.

title: Top shares to buy: Stock recommendations for today- check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research highlights Fortis Healthcare and Jio Financial Services as top stock picks for November 21, 2025. Nifty and Bank Nifty show positive momentum, with Nifty eyeing its all-time high and Bank Nifty setting new records.

title: Indian-origin employee gifted $40,000 by McDonald‚Äôs restaurant owner. Here's why
content: After four decades of dedicated service at a McDonald's in Saugus, Massachusetts, Pargan Singh, endearingly called 'Balbir', has become a local hero. His colleagues, who have watched him grow from a beginner to a beloved team member, surprised him with a lavish red-carpet tribute and a generous $40,000 gift, celebrating an incredible journey of commitment and camaraderie.

title: Lamb: Missed Vegas curfew prompted benching
content: Cowboys wide receiver CeeDee Lamb said he and George Pickens missed curfew Sunday, which resulted in both players missing the first series of Monday's game against the Raiders.

title: Lakers fire Buss brothers from scouting roles
content: The Lakers are reorganizing their basketball operations department and have terminated brothers Joey and Jesse Buss from their respective front office positions.

title: Sources: Players unmoved by WNBA's proposal
content: The WNBPA believes the league's latest CBA proposal misses the mark and does not include a system where the salary cap and player salaries sufficiently grow with the business, sources told ESPN.

title: Maxey has career-high 54 as 76ers outlast Bucks
content: Sixers guard Tyrese Maxey had a career-high 54 points and nine assists in a 123-114 overtime victory over the Bucks on Thursday.

title: Ovechkin's hat trick puts him 10th on points list
content: Alex Ovechkin had his 33rd career hat trick and added an assist to move into 10th place on the NHL points list, helping the Capitals beat Montreal 8-4 on Thursday night.

title: Darnold: Seattle's NFL-high 20 TO's 'unacceptable'
content: Seahawks quarterback Sam Darnold says he understands he and the team have to be better protecting the ball after a four-week stretch in which they've committed 12 turnovers, bringing their NFL-worst total to 20.

title: Las Vegas GP: Drain cover causes red flags again
content: The 2023 Las Vegas GP saw Carlos Sainz's Ferrari damaged by a loose drain cover, with the 2025 edition causing red flags in FP2.

title: Whitmore No. 1 in WPBL draft; Davis No. 10
content: Kelsie Whitmore was selected by San Francisco with the first pick in the inaugural Women's Pro Baseball League draft, while Mo'ne Davis went to Los Angeles at No. 10.

title: üèÄ Men's CBB Power Rankings: Arizona is No. 1
content: The Wildcats added another statement win to their early-season r√©sum√©, headlining this week's top-25 risers.

title: Your guide to women's college basketball Feast Week: Best games to watch over the next 10 days
content: From the Players Era in Las Vegas to Bahamas tournaments, the next 10 days are filled with big nonconference games.

title: Grading preseason bold predictions for all 32 NHL teams
content: Some of our wild takes from September don't look so wild anymore. Others are way off base. Here's an update.

content: Florida's championship rings feature significant nods to the national title game, its iconic season and program history.

title: Week 13 preview: Stakes in key conference matchups, breakout players and more
content: Our college football experts tell us what's at stake in key conference matchups, plus breakout players and more.

title: Should the Tigers trade Tarik Skubal? We asked around MLB
content: Will the best pitcher in baseball be on the move this offseason? Those in the game offer their advice.

title: How a baseball behemoth plans to get better? 3 questions as Dodgers eye three-peat
content: L.A.'s blueprint to bolster a two-time defending champion will be among MLB's biggest stories this winter.

title: Barnwell: Is Nick Sirianni the most scrutinized successful coach in NFL history?
content: The Eagles' head coach is 56-22 over five seasons, including two trips to the Super Bowl. Yet he's constantly under the microscope. Why?

title: NWSL faces litmus test to retain Trinity Rodman's star power
content: Trinity Rodman represents some of the very best that the NWSL has to offer. That's why Saturday's NWSL Championship -- perhaps her final game -- feels so significant.

title: Early trade deadline questions: What's next for Giannis, Lakers and top contenders?
content: Early NBA trade deadline questions for Bucks, Lakers, Warriors and other top contenders, including biggest needs and what they can pull off.

title: Jimmy Butler, Steve Kerr and the Warriors' quest to solve the Jonathan Kuminga puzzle
content: Butler has taken on a mentorship role with Kuminga, who is still trying to find his role with the Warriors.

content: Even Jonathan Taylor can't do it all by himself. Fantasy managers have a role to play too.  Here's what to do.

title: The Playbook: Lineup locks, Shadow Reports for Week 12
content: An all-encompassing look at matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores.

title: Las Vegas Grand Prix: What to know ahead of the F1 weekend
content: With three races remaining of the 2025 season, Formula 1 heads to Las Vegas for the third edition of the glitzy grand prix. Find out all the timings, stats and information for the weekend.

title: Oklahoma's anthracite alternates headline top college football uniforms for Week 13
content: Oklahoma will ditch their usual crimson and cream color palette for just this week, donning their anthracite "Unity" alternates against Missouri.

title: 'You don't want to have the same drip': How a Houston Christian receiver became a shoe artist to the stars
content: Why Travis Hunter, Jeremiah Smith and Caitlin Clark have custom shoes from this Houston Christian freshman.

title: 2026 World Cup playoff draw: Who will fill the final six spots?
content: Six spots remain up for grabs at the 2026 World Cup, with four to emerge from Europe and a further two from an intercontinental playoff. What's the draw, and who will advance? We make our picks.

title: Expert picks, best bets: How Tsarukyan can reenter title contention
content: MMA experts give their predictions for a UFC Fight Night from Doha, Qatar, headlined by lightweight contenders Arman Tsarukyan and Dan Hooker.

title: Bradley's take: Can Haney avoid Norman's left hook?
content: Timothy Bradley Jr. breaks down the Brian Norman Jr.-Devin Haney title fight, and shares his thoughts on how the fight could play out.

title: The running man: Odds are Josh Allen makes QB TD history on Thursday night
content: The Buffalo Bills' MVP is one rushing TD away from becoming the NFL's all-time leader in rushing TDs by a QB. Will he get it Thursday?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye Ajax young talent Mokio
content: Manchester United are keeping tabs on rising young talent Jorthy Mokio from Ajax. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Amit Shah's "Saving Infiltrator" Jibe After Mamata Banerjee Writes To Poll Body
content: Some political parties are trying to "protect infiltrators" by hindering the process for the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said on Friday.

title: "Foreign Students Serve As Spies": Nikki Haley's Son Nalin's Anti-Immigration Rant
content: Just over a week after he called for halting "legal immigration", Nalin Haley, the son of former US ambassador to the United Nations Nikki Haley, has said that naturalised citizens should not be able to hold office.

title: Jaipur Class 4 Student's Last Hours Before Suicide Revealed In Probe Report
content: A Class 4 student, who died by suicide at a prestigious school in Jaipur, had approached her class teacher five times and sought her support for 45 minutes over alleged bullying but was not offered any help.

title: Google Launches Unauthorized Pixel-To-iPhone File SharingWith Apples AirDrop
content: Alphabet Inc.s Google said it has developed a way for its latest Pixel smartphones to exchange images and other files with iPhones using Apple Inc.s AirDrop protocol.

title: US Immigration Fees Set To Increase In 2026: How It May Impact Indians
content: The US will increase the immigration and border-related fees starting January 1, 2026, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) has announced.

title: Gujarat Forest Officer Who Killed Wife, Children Had Affair With Colleague For Years
content: The accused, identified as Assistant Conservator of Forests (ACF) Shailesh Khambhla (39), befriended the woman forest worker in 2022.

title: 5.7-Magnitude Earthquake Hits Bangladesh, Tremors Felt In Kolkata
content: Mild tremors were felt in Kolkata on Friday after a 5.5-magnitude earthquake struck Bangladesh's Ghorashal area.

title: Trump Plan Targets Florida, California For Coastal Oil Drilling
content: The Trump administration is proposing to open new areas off of California, Florida and Alaska to crude drilling as part of a draft blueprint released Thursday that would dramatically expand the sale of oil and natural gas rights.

title: UK Plans To Overhaul Immigration Policy. How It Will Affect Indians
content: In its biggest immigration shake-up in nearly half a century, the United Kingdom is planning to make some legal migrants wait up to 20 years before letting them apply to settle in Britain permanently.

title: Watch: Korean Lawmaker Sings Vande Mataram At WAVES Film Bazaar Opening
content: The 19th edition of the WAVES Film Bazaar opened with an unexpected moment on Thursday when South Korean lawmaker Jaewon Kim sang Vande Mataram during the inaugural ceremony.

title: Lloyds Ex-CEO Lost Rs 150 Crore Job After Office Romance
content: American International Group Inc.'s announcement last week that it was parting ways with incoming President John Neal stunned insurance industry observers and raised questions about what caused the veteran executive to lose a $17 million job.

title: US Coast Guard To Call Swastikas, Nooses "Potentially Divisive"
content: The US Coast Guard is poised to change some of its language and policies surrounding the display of hate symbols like swastikas and nooses as well as how personnel report hate incidents.

title: 'Very Intense Earthquake, Building Shook For 30 Seconds': Kolkata Residents On Tremors
content: An earthquake of magnitude 5.7struck Bangladesh's Narsingdi on Friday morning, with the tremors being felt in parts of West Bengal, including Kolkata.

title: Only Aviation Workers With Perfect Attendance During US Shutdown To Get Bonus
content: Only 776 of the more than 10,000 air traffic controllers who had to work without pay during the shutdown will receive the $10,000 bonuses that President Donald Trump suggested.

title: "Stand And Greet": New SOP For Maharashtra Officials To Welcome Politicians
content: The Maharashtra government has ordered its employees to treat all visiting Members of Parliament (MPs) and Members of Legislative Assembly (MLAs) with respect by "standing up and greeting" them.

title: Over 200 Al Falah University Doctors, Staff Under Scanner After Delhi Blast
content: More than 200 doctors and staff at Al Falah University here are under the scanner of the investigative agencies following the blast in a car near the Red Fort on November 10, sources said.

title: Reliance Halts Russian Oil Imports To Export Refinery Amid EU Sanctions
content: Reliance Industries Ltd has said it has halted the use of Russian crude at its export-only refinery in Jamnagar, Gujarat, as the company moves to comply with European Union sanctions.

title: Adani Group Sells Remaining 7% Stake In Adani Wilmar Ltd In Block Deal
content: Adani Group has sold its remaining 7 per cent stake in Adani Wilmar Ltd in a block deal that attracted strong institutional demand.

title: Delhi Bomber Had Made Radical Videos, Took Online Sessions On Suicide Bombing: Sources
content: Umar - who was recruited into the white collar terror module by other suspects in Haryana's Al-Falah University - shared other videos by radical Islamists with a group of people he was interacting with through encrypted apps.

title: Family from Bagalkot loses five-year-old baby in leopard attack, Karnataka Forest Department begins operation to capture wild animal
content: Sanvi was playing in front of the shed where her family stays when the leopard attacked and carried her away

title: Government claim that lawmakers cannot discuss ECI is violation of powers of Parliament: Derek O'Brien
content: The budget of the ECI... is subject to Parliamentary approval and is presented by the Union government through the Ministry of Law and Justice. This means that Parliament does have the power to scrutinise and discuss the ECI by virtue of holding the power of the purse, says TMC leader Derek O'Brien

title: Ballari jeans units with own ETP get approval to re-open: MLA Nara Bharath Reddy
content: The units had been shut down by the Karnataka State Pollution Control Board (KSPCB) for mishandling of effluent

title: Seven BLOs of Kolkata issued show-cause notices by ECI
content: The complaint concerns improper and incomplete digitisation of collected enumeration forms, says the official

title: World collectively needs to hike climate finance: India at COP30
content: Bhupender Yadav highlighted India‚Äôs efforts and experiences in accessing adaptation finance, the barriers faced by developing countries and the global steps needed to raise adaptation ambition

title: Himachal man who lost his memory reunited with family after 45 years
content: Rikhi was working at a hotel in Haryana's Yamunanagar when he met with a major road accident during a trip to Ambala. He sustained a head injury and went missing back in 1980

title: Instrumental music band Shanka Tribe on their debut EP, ‚ÄòUmoja‚Äô
content: The 20-minute long EP has three tracks featuring instruments such as didjeridoo, djembe, conga, handpan, darbuka, bongo, and oud

title: RSS involvement will not resolve Manipur crisis: Congress president Meghachandra
content: Reacting to the three-day tour of RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat, he said any visit that "prioritises strengthening organisational growth" over the suffering of the people sends a wrong message

title: No rest until Constitution is amended to fix timelines for Governors to clear Bills: T.N. CM Stalin
content: In a social media post, Mr. Stalin said the Supreme Court‚Äôs opinion in its answer to the Presidential Reference ‚Äúwill have no impact on the April 8, 2025 judgment in the case of State of Tamil Nadu v. Governor of Tamil Nadu.‚Äù

content: Additional Solicitor General S.V. Raju said to secure their goals, Umar Khalid and Imam broke the secure fabric of JNU and also used and instigated the students of Jamia.¬†

title: IndiGo approves capital investment of over ‚Çπ7,000 crore for aircraft ownership in shift away from leasing
content: The move is expected to shield the airline from foreign exchange fluctuations, as lease payments are typically dollar-denominated

title: Kerala vehicle fitness test fees surge up to tenfold amid new regulations by Centre
content: After Ministry of Road Transport and Highways hiked fees by amending Central Motor Vehicle Rules (Fifth Amendment) recently, Kerala Motor Vehicles dept has enforced revised rates for fitness tests

title: Al-Falah Group chairman‚Äôs family property in Mhow gets notice for unauthorised construction
content: As per the notice, the department had previously issued multiple communications dating back to 1996 and 1997 under relevant sections of the Cantonments Act, 1924, directing the removal of the unauthorised construction,‚Äù the Cantonment Engineer said

title: Jawaharlal Nehru‚Äôs writings are not just history, they are record of India's evolving conscience, says Rahul Gandhi
content: The Leader of the Opposition in the Lok Sabha remarks came over the completion of the digitisation of 'Selected Works of Jawaharlal Nehru'

title: U.S. sanctions Indian entities, individuals involved in Iranian petroleum and petroleum products sales
content: Those sanctioned include Zair Husain Iqbal Husain Sayed, Zulfikar Hussain Rizvi Sayed, Maharashtra-based RN Ship Management Private Limited and Pune-based TR6 Petro India LLP

title: Allahabad High Court refuses to quash FIR against accused in Bareilly violence case
content: As per the prosecution‚Äôs case, Maulana Tauqeer Raza had allegedly given a call to members of a particular community to assemble at the Islamiya Inter College in Bareilly on September 26

title: West Bengal government convenes meeting with District Magistrates over 2026 Assembly polls on Saturday
content: "It will focus on the electoral infrastructure and Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs). Those in remote districts will join via the virtual mode," say sources

title: Strong tremors felt in Kolkata, other parts of West Bengal
content: According to official data from the National Center for Seismology, the earthquake was of 5.7 magnitude and occurred in Bangladesh, at a depth of 10 km

title: Centre announces top-level bureaucratic reshuffle; Neeraj Mittal appointed Petroleum and Natural Gas secretary
content: Amit Agrawal, secretary, Department of Pharmaceuticals, has been appointed as Telecommunications secretary, in place of Mr. Mittal

title: Deputy Commissioner Fouzia Taranum directs permanent relocation of dogs from school and hospital premises in Kalaburagi district
content: She instructed that stray cattle obstructing traffic on State and National Highways and other major roads must be permanently shifted to designated cattle shelters or gaushalas

title: Aerial adventure: Paramotoring activities begin in Visakhapatnam
content: Tandem paramotoring at Rushikonda and Sagarnagar is drawing visitors eager to see the coastline from the air

title: ED raids residences of former MLA P.V. Anvar, relatives in Kerala in load fraud case
content: Multiple teams of ED from Chennai, Kochi and Kozhikode units, supported by the Central police force, began the raids at six houses soon after dawn

title: ED conducts searches in Jharkhand, West Bengal amid crackdown on ‚Äòcoal mafia‚Äô
content: More than 40 premises in the two States are being covered as part of the action under the provisions of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA)

title: G20 Summit LIVE updates: PM Modi leaves for three-day visit to South Africa, says will present India‚Äôs perspective in line with vision
content: This will be a particularly special Summit given that it would be the first G20 Summit being held in Africa, PM Modi said in his departure statement

title: I practice Buddhism, but I believe in all religions: CJI B. R. Gavai
content: Justice Gavai also said the Supreme Court should not be a CJI-centric court but a court of all the judges

title: Kerala local body polls: Perform or perish is the mantra for political fronts in central Kerala
content: Barring Ernakulam district, the CPI (M)-led LDF has been sitting pretty in all the other three districts of the region. Much is at stake for the UDF and the Congress in these districts, as the dispensation has been forced to sit in the Opposition in most of the local bodies during the last term. The NDA was nowhere in the political scene in the region during the last election

title: Kerala local body polls: UDF poised for a comeback in Thrissur, says Rajan J. Pallan
content: Congress leader and Leader of Opposition in the Thrissur Corporation says a strong and unmistakable wave is rising in favour of the Congress and voters are ready to correct what he calls the slip between the lip and the cup in the last election

title: Kerala local body polls: Elections in Pala heat up as CPI(M) renegade comes up with family alliance
content: Binu Pulikkakkandam has assembled a three-member alliance comprising only his close family. Under the plan, he will contest from Ward 14, while his daughter Diya will enter the race from Ward 15, and his brother Biju Pulikkakandam will contest from Ward 13

title: Faridabad Police forms SIT to probe Al Falah University's activities
content: The SIT, which consists of two assistant commissioners of police, an inspector, and two sub-inspectors, is preparing a comprehensive report on the university's activities

title: Is air pollution a South Asian crisis? | Explained
content: What was the 2024 India-Pakistan Smog? How has air pollution become rampant across the South Asian region? What does the Greenpeace 2023 World Air Quality Report state? How do deteriorating AQI levels affect India economically? What should be the way ahead?

title: IMD issues cyclone alert over Bay of Bengal, heavy rain likely in Andaman
content: Squally weather with surface wind speed reaching 35-45 kmph gusting to 55 kmph is very likely over the Andaman Sea

title: PM Modi embarks on visit to South Africa to attend G20 summit
content: During his stay in Johannesburg, the Prime Minister will also attend the sixth IBSA Summit on the sidelines of the G20

title: Nudging children to swap screens for sports
content: In Telangana‚Äôs rural and tribal belts, a growing partnership between NRI groups and the government is pushing chess and other sports into State-run school campuses as a way to build focus and healthier habits

title: Andhra Pradesh may see another cyclone next week
content: Rayalaseema and South Coastal A.P. may receive moderate rain between November 26 and 29, while heavy to very heavy rainfall is likely at isolated places on November 27 and 28

title: How welfare delivery shaped, but did not decide, Bihar‚Äôs elections
content: The Bihar verdict reflects how widespread welfare delivery, clear credit attribution, and powerful job promises shaped voter choices

title: Integrated Child Development Services programme: A 50-year lifeline
content: Fifty years after it was launched as a pilot project in T. Narasipur in Mysuru district, the ICDS programme has expanded in reach and scope across Karnataka. But the crucial scheme for early childhood development faces several challenges, especially of fund crunch, says Shilpa Elizabeth

title: The caste and class factors in the NDA‚Äôs victory in Bihar
content: The majority of upper caste voters, OBCS (except Yadavs), and Dalits chose the NDA, as did a majority of the upper and middle class voters

title: Rebooting R.K. Narayan for the new-age reader
content: Sita Bhaskar‚Äôs novel inspired by the real-life tussle over Narayan‚Äôs home aims to bring back the Malgudi magic

title: Multipurpose National Identity Card: Once there was a card to prove citizenship
content: With no designated document to establish proof of Indian citizenship,¬†Vijaita Singh¬†explores the Multipurpose National Identity Card that was issued on a pilot basis in 2008, the laws and debate around citizenship, and the documents needed for the special intensive revision of voter lists rolled out in 12 States and Union Territories

title: Bombay High Court raps Maharashtra over Melghat malnutrition deaths
content: Bombay High Court slams Maharashtra for ‚Äòsheer negligence‚Äô as 65 infants die of malnutrition in¬†Melghat, ordering top officials to appear and file urgent action plans

title: GE Aerospace to invest $14 million in its Pune manufacturing facility
content: The company announced it will invest $14 million in the Pune manufacturing facility and added that the investment builds upon the $30 million announced last year

title: Another official on SIR duty dies in Rajasthan
content: On November 19, 2025, Santram Saini, a government school teacher, experienced sharp chest pain and vomiting at his home in Karsooli village and was rushed to a hospital, but he died on the way, his family said

title: How a Brahmin woman was elected the Mayor of Madras on¬†DMK¬†ticket in 1971
content: In the communal rotation system that was in place for the post, Kamakshi¬†Jayaraman¬†won the election held on November 29 that year, securing 74 votes¬†as against the 47 votes polled by her nearest rival¬†C.R.¬†Narasimhan¬†of the¬†Swatantra¬†Party. She was a¬†DMK¬†member like her husband. She also became the second woman Mayor of Madras¬†

title: St. George‚Äôs Cathedral: a living heritage in Chennai gets a facelift
content: St. George‚Äôs Cathedral, established in 1816 on what is now called Cathedral Road in Madras, was recently rededicated¬†after renovation under the supervision of experts of¬†IIT¬†Madras. It is the mother church for the¬†CSI¬†and the Diocese of Madras

title: When¬†Rajaji, Congress legislators of Madras Presidency favoured two-nation theory
content: Amid the Second World War, the Congress Legislature Party convened in Madras on April 23, 1942, at the behest of¬†Rajaji.¬†It passed two resolutions urging the¬†AICC¬†to acknowledge the Muslim League‚Äôs claim for Pakistan and allow a government to be formed in the Presidency along with the League. Both proved controversial and failed

title: Ahead of civic polls, Uddhav targets Shinde over Delhi visit; BJP rules out tie-up with Nawab Malik
content: Ahead of civic polls, opposition attacks¬†Eknath¬†Shinde over Amit Shah meeting as BJP distances itself from¬†Nawab¬†Malik amid money laundering charges.

title: Railway engineers seek anticipatory bail in Mumbra train accident case
content: The plea requests bail for those named in FIR and highlights urgent safety and infrastructure issues on the Mumbai suburban railway network.¬†

title: Ujjain land pooling: BKS calls govt notification on Simhastha planning misleading; warns of restarting protest
content: The BKS has raised suspicious over the government‚Äôs ‚Äúintent‚Äù and warned of restarting the agitation while demanding a complete roll back of the scheme

title: BJP highlights plight of tea garden workers in North Bengal, demands implementation of new labour codes

title: IMD forecasts a developing depression over Bay of Bengal

title: Manipur police sent incomplete, incorrect clips for forensic analysis, Kuki group tells Supreme Court

title: Protesters attempt to storm festival venue in Manipur; police resort to lathi charge

title: Fixing what's wrong with Liverpool, Barcelona, Juventus, more

title: Eagles' kelly green, Texans' battle red uniforms top NFL Week 12 threads
content: the Houston Texans are wearing their all-battle-red threads on "Thursday Night Football" the combination debuted last season and features a bullhorn on the helmet and shoulder . the Eagles remain undefeated in the look since it debuted in 2023 . for the first time in franchise history, the saints are wearing all-black .

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: Ohio State, Miami, Iowa on the rise
content: a wave of commitments, decommitments and flips largely driven by three-star prospects shook up these rankings . the number of remaining undeclared prospects in the SC Next 300 is in single digits, but heading into the initial signing period for the 2026 class, many factors can still drive changes .

title: Texans defense, Davis Mills come up big in TNF win against Bills
content: the Texans are back in the playoff race after a massive 23-19 win against the Buffalo Bills . the defense showed why it's the no. 1-ranked defense in prime time . they have a 37% chance to make the playoffs, per ESPN Analytics .

title: Flyers to honor young cancer patients with pregame SkateSkins

title: Chelsea make UWCL statement of intent as Barcelona's perfect run comes to an end
content: a UEFA women's champions league match had a delay of eight minutes . the match was played at a frenetic pace, only for the match to be halted in the 37th minute . it seemed to be because of a technical fault in the stadium . both teams are favourites to lift the trophy this season .
